source.value: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City

details.flavorText: When a creature dies, and for whatever reason its spirit is unable or unwilling to leave the site of its death, that spirit may manifest as a poltergeist: a restless invisible spirit that is still able to manipulate physical objects. Many poltergeists perished in a way that resulted from or has led to extreme emotional trauma.

di.custom: death effects, disease, paralyzed, poison, precision, unconscious

dr.exceptions: force, ghost touch, or positive; double resistance against non-magical
dr.label: All Damage

description.value: Saggorak Poltergeists cannot travel more than 120 feet from area F2.
A poltergeist is naturally invisible. It becomes visible only when it uses Frighten.

When a poltergeist is destroyed, it re-forms, fully healed, where it was destroyed after 2d4 days. These Saggorak Poltergeists no longer rejuvenate once King Harral no longer exists as an undead ruler of Saggorak.
Trigger A creature approaches within 10 feet of the poltergeist. Effect The poltergeist makes a telekinetic object Strike against the triggering creature.

Requirement The poltergeist must be invisible. Effect The poltergeist becomes visible, appearing as a skeletal, ghostlike humanoid. Each creature within 30 feet must attempt a DC 33 Will save, becoming @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} 2 on a failure. On a critical failure, it’s also @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for as long as it’s @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}. On a success, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute. At the start of its next turn, the poltergeist becomes invisible again.

The poltergeist telekinetically throws numerous small objects, such as dozens of pieces of silverware or books, either spreading them out among multiple foes or directing them at one target.
  • When this effect is spread out among multiple foes, the poltergeist makes a telekinetic object Strike at a –2 penalty against each creature within 30 feet. These count as one attack for the poltergeist’s multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn’t increase until after all the attacks.
  • When this effect has only one target, the poltergeist makes a telekinetic object Strike against the target, and the damage increases to 6d12. It deals [[/r 2d12 # damage]] damage on a failure, and no damage on a critical failure.
You move the target up to 20 feet, potentially suspending it in midair. When you Sustain the Spell, you can do so again, or you can choose a different eligible target to move.
description.label: Description

target.value: 1 object of up to 80 Bulk with no dimension longer than 20 feet
target.label: Target

description.value: With a rush of telekinetic power, you move a foe or something they carry. You can attempt to Disarm, Shove, or Trip the target using a spell attack roll instead of an Athletics check.
description.label: Description

description.value:
You create a single magical hand, either invisible or ghostlike, that grasps the target object and moves it slowly up to 20 feet. Because you're levitating the object, you can move it in any direction. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move the object an additional 20 feet. If the object is in the air when the spell ends, the object falls.

Heightened You can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

Heightened The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.
description.label: Description

target.value: 1 unattended object of light Bulk or less
target.label: Target
